description.narrative:
Kiambaa Dairy Farmers' Co-operative Society was founded in 1963 and aims to be the market option for dairy farmers and consumers in Nairobi and its environs. The cooperative has a membership of approximately 1600 smallholder dairy farmers and collects, cools and trades currently 17,500 lts/day (November, 2017). In addition, the cooperative also provides other services to members and non members like supply of farm inputs, extension and AI services. Kiambaa Dairy is situated in Kiambu district in Central Kenya Province. It is estimated that 10 to 15% per cent of its members are youths and 60% female. In 2014 the Board of Kiambaa Dairy agreed to expand and improve the processing factory. The acquisition of a plot just outside the village and the contribution by ABTB Foundation, through Agriterra, of € 250,000 made it possible to build a new factory. The construction of it started in May 2016 and is finished in December 2017. Processing at the new plant started in Jan. 2018. End of 2017 total supply by members was 17,500 l/day, total overcapacity was 25,000 l/day and break even around 23,000 l/day. To close this gap the production per farmer must increase and milk has to be acquired from other suppliers/coops. The increased production also needs higher sales.
This year the support by Agriterra is focused on the start of factory (technical design), increase of production (2 more extension officers, ToT for extension) of and sustainable implementation the processing plant (new strategic plan, exchange visit, market approach/branding). The support by Agriterra is focused on increase of production (4 more extension officers, continued extension) and sustainable implementation the processing plant (new strategic plan) with expanding and new market and a new brand.
Increase of production to 25,000 l/day;increased milk supply, both by members and other coops;Increased sales of processed milk, yogurt;New branding;Completed management staff (mktg.mgr.; prod.mgr.)
